awd_titl_txt: Interactions of Arctic Ecosystems with Regional and         Global Climate
awd_abstract_narration: This award is part of the Arctic System Science (ARCSS) Program,                a U.S. Global Change Program.  The research project will focus on               integrated research that explores interactions between arctic                   terrestrial ecosystems and climate.  Field research will be                     related to measurements of tundra to determine the environmental                and vegetation correlates of fluxes of water, energy and trace                  gases especially carbon dioxide and methane. Field studies will                 measure the movement of carbon dioxide and methane to and from                  the soil and vegetation in the Arctic.  This project is a                       component of a larger interdisciplinary program know as the ARCSS               FLUX Program.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, THE
